argument.description: The length of the result after string has been left-padded.
The specified string to left-pad to string.

description: The PostgreSQL lpad function returns a string that is left-padded with a specified string to a certain length.
sample:
postgres=# SELECT lpad('techonthenet.com', 18, 'A');
        lpad
----------------------
 'AAtechonthenet.com'
(1 row)

postgres=# SELECT lpad('techonthenet.com', 19, 'A');
        lpad
-----------------------
 'AAAtechonthenet.com'
(1 row)

postgres=# SELECT lpad('abc', 6, ' ');
   lpad
----------
 '   abc'
(1 row)

postgres=# SELECT lpad('abc', 9, 'XYZ');
    lpad
-------------
 'XYZXYZabc'
(1 row)

postgres=# SELECT lpad('abc', 10, 'XYZ');
    lpad
--------------
 'XYZXYZXabc'
(1 row)
